AHF.caption: List of items
AHF.doc: A list of texts, number, dates and anything else supported. Will be the body of the column.
AHF.name: list_of_items

AHG.caption: Table name
AHG.doc: Name of the table that will receive this column.
AHG.name: table_name

AHH.caption: Column width
AHH.doc: How much space the column will take.
AHH.name: column_width

AHI.caption: Column header
AHI.doc: Optional. The text that will be in the header, works as a title or label. Header examples are "Name, Phone, Email, Cost".
AHI.name: column_header

AHJ.caption: Header style
AHJ.doc: The name of the text style to be applied to the text of this column's header.
AHJ.name: header_style

AHY.caption: Text body style
AHY.doc: The name of the text style to be applied to the texts in this column.
AHY.name: text_body_style

AHZ.caption: Using images
AHZ.doc: Everything below is only relevant if you're using images in this column. Pass "yes" here and the list will be rendered as an image list. You can pass both "image" field type or a "text" field type containing a list of image URLs.
AHZ.name: using_images

AHa.caption: Image width
AHa.doc: You can leave this empty, then it will use the image's original size. Specify only width and the image will scale proportionaly, specify both width and height and the image will distort to fit. Applied to the entire column.
AHa.name: image_width

AHb.caption: Image height
AHb.doc: You can leave this empty, then it will use the image's original size. Specify only width and the image will scale proportionaly, specify both width and height and the image will distort to fit. Applied to the entire column.
AHb.name: image_height

AHd.caption: Below you will be able to set extra margins for your image or text element. Leave the field as "no" for a default display. (Will ignore any numbers below)
AHd.name: below_you_will_be_able_to_set_extra_margins_for_your_image_element._leave_the_box_unchecked_for_a_default_display._(will_ignore_any_numbers_below)

AHi.caption: Fixed width size
AHi.doc: If you select the option "Fixed width" in the dropdown above, then you have to specify it here. This will be ignored if you select the another option.
AHi.name: specified_column_width

AON.caption: Parse BBCode?
AON.doc: Remember that the style defined in BBCode will override the same style defined in the "Define new style for" action
AON.name: parse_bbcode
